herobanner.jcr:description: Have diabetes? This glucose monitoring tool could revolutionize your life with fast, reliable results without the need for routine finger sticks1.
herobanner.jcr:title: Hi, FreeStyle Libre System. Bye, Routine Finger Sticks (1)

product-section-text-list.textAboveList: Monitor and share your glucose values ​​remotely!

item0.listText: The FreeStyle LibreLink app has many of the features found in your FreeStyle Libre reader 6 .
item0.text: You can monitor your glucose level on your smartphone without a fingertip¹

item1.listText: With LibreLinkUp 20 you can allow up to 20 people to follow your glucose data and glucose trends via their smartphone 7 .

section-title.jcr:title: See trends and patterns to help you manage diabetes better.

description.text: a diagram showing the pattern and variability of the sensor's glucose measurements during a normal day³
shows which percentage of the time the sensor's glucose measurements were in, above or below the target range for glucose measurements

displays measurements lower
than 3.9 mmol/L (for at least 15 minutes) over four different 6-hour periods during the day

video.videoCaption: What is the difference between measuring glucose in tissue fluid compared to blood

product_feature_text_2_4.text: Uses FreeStyle Lite Insulinx test strips only

link-text.jcr:title: DETAILED COMPARISON OF ALL FREEESTYLE SYSTEMS

promo-text.text: Now you can monitor your glucose on your smartphone without fingersticks. Enjoy many of the same features on your smartphone as your reader.

item_1607445693247.description: After scanning the sensor with a reader, the glucose readings measured by the sensor will be displayed. The readings include the current glucose value and a glucose trend arrow showing the direction of glucose progression, as well as a graph showing glucose history over an eight-hour period.

item_1607445704415.description:
The daily graph shows the values ​​for the entire previous day and allows you to check if the glucose levels have remained within the target range for 24 hours.

Keep track of periods when your glucose levels are outside the glucose period marked in blue. Do these periods coincide with the meal as indicated by the apple icon?

item_1607445717855.description: A graph showing the percentage of time that the sensor glucose readings were below, above, or within the target glucose range.

item_1607446826653.text: The sensor is 5 mm high and 35 mm in diameter.

item_1607446837960.cq:panelTitle: How far is the sensor in?
item_1607446837960.text:
The part of the sensor indented under the skin is less than 0.4 mm wide and is only indented about 5 mm under the skin. Studies show that a large number of users thought that the trick did not hurt more than a normal glucose test by pricking the finger15

15. Most people experienced no discomfort under the skin when wearing the FreeStyle Libre sensor. In a study conducted by Abbott Diabetes Care, 93.4% of patients examined (n=30) fully agree with or agree that they did not experience any discomfort under the skin while wearing the sensor. [29 people have completed the study, 1 person discontinued the study after 3 days due to skin irritations in the area where the sensor was in contact with the skin.]

item_1607446856862.cq:panelTitle: Can I swim, shower, swim or work out while wearing the sensor?
item_1607446856862.text: Yes. The sensor can be worn while bathing, showering, swimming, or exercising. The sensor should not be taken down at a water depth of more than 1 metre and should not be immersed in water for more than 30 minutes.

item_1607446869449.cq:panelTitle: Can I carry my sensor when I go through security at an airport?
item_1607446869449.text:
The FreeStyle Libre reader and The FreeStyle Libre sensor can be exposed to common electrostatic and electromagnetic interference, including metal detectors at airports. You can continue to wear the sensor as you go through these.

However, the FreeStyle Libre reader and the FreeStyle Libre sensor must not be exposed to certain full-body scanners (i.e. X-rays and millimeter radio waves). To avoid removing your FreeStyle Libre sensor, notify security personnel before going through airport security.

item_1607447079385.cardLink: A graph showing the percentage of time that the sensor glucose readings were below, above, or within the target glucose range.

largeHeading0.jcr:title: What happens if the reader is discharged? Will the glucose readings disappear if the reader is discharged?

text.text: The reader must be charged if the power runs out. The stored glucose readings in the reader do not disappear. The reader usually charges fully in about 3 hours if the battery is completely discharged.

largeHeading1.jcr:title: How far is the sensor inserted?

text.text:
The part of the sensor that is inserted under the skin is less than 0.4 mm wide and is only inserted about 5 mm under the skin. Studies show that a large number of users thought that the sting did not hurt more than a regular glucose test through a sting in the finger 15

15. Most people did not experience any discomfort under the skin when wearing the FreeStyle Libre sensor. In a study conducted by Abbott Diabetes Care, 93.4% of the patients examined (n = 30) completely agree or agree that they did not experience any discomfort under the skin while wearing the sensor. [29 people completed the study, 1 person discontinued the study after 3 days due to skin irritation in the area where the sensor was in contact with the skin.]

largeHeading2.jcr:title: What is the FreeStyle LibreLink mobile app?

text.text:
The FreeStyle LibreLink app is a medical mobile app designed to be used with FreeStyle Libre sensors.

The app allows you to monitor your glucose using your iPhone or Android phone with a FreeStyle Libre - you do not need to use a separate blood glucose meter for routine glucose monitoring 1 . When you read the sensor with a compatible phone using the FreeStyle LibreLink app, your glucose data is displayed directly on this device.

The app makes it possible to:

 View your current glucose value, a trend arrow indicating how your glucose value is changing, and the last 8 hours of glucose history

 View glucose reports, including your outpatient glucose profile, that reveal trends and patterns

 Add notes to track your food, insulin use, exercise and other events

 Connect to healthcare professionals and caregivers with LibreView and LibreLinkUp

To be able to use the FreeStyle LibreLink app, you must register with LibreView. See the FreeStyle Libre manual and the FreeStyle LibreLink app for specific instructions on how to use different products.

A fingertip test with a blood glucose meter is required when glucose levels change rapidly as the glucose levels in the interstitial fluid may not accurately reflect blood glucose levels or if the system reports hypoglycaemia or threatening hypoglycaemia or when the symptoms do not match the system readings.

section-subtitle.text:
If you do not find the answers to your questions in the questions and answers section, you can also send an e-mail by filling in your contact details in the form below or by calling our customer service on 020-190 11 11.

Avoid waiting time
We have a higher load on incoming calls on Mondays
between 08: 00-10: 00 and day after holiday.
